We refer to Wikipedia articles on computer vision for help. The MRN is a six-layer fully convolutional network which takes an image as input and produces a probability distribution over the classes. So, when the speaker mentions this, a diagram showing the architecture of the MRN would be displayed on the screen.

Therefore, the answer is (B).
Option B: A slide showing ImageNet branches for mammals and vehicles with two rows of sample images and a note about 9 images per synset.
